     6  package parlfs
     7  
     8  import (
     9  	"fmt"
    10  	"io"
    11  	"io/fs"
    12  	"os"
    13  	"path/filepath"
    14  	"sync/atomic"
    15  	"syscall"
    16  
    17  	"github.com/haraldrudell/parl"
    18  )
    19  
    20  type DirectoryLister struct {
    21  	Path       string // may begin with ., may be .
    22  	Abs        string
    23  	Results    chan *EntryResult
    24  	sdChan     chan struct{}
    25  	isShutdown parl.AtomicBool
    26  	output     chan *EntryResult
    27  	pinger     chan struct{}
    28  	readEnd    bool
    29  	dirFile    *os.File
    30  	no         int32
    31  	name       string
    32  }
    33  
    34  const (
    35  	chanSizeDefault = 5
    36  )
    37  
    38  var instanceNo int32
    39  
    40  func NewDirStream(path string, chanSize int) (dir *DirectoryLister) {
    41  	if chanSize < 1 {
    42  		chanSize = chanSizeDefault
    43  	}
    44  	cleaned := filepath.Clean(path)
    45  	abs, err := filepath.Abs(cleaned)
    46  	if err != nil {
    47  		panic(parl.Errorf("filepath.Abs(%q) '%w'", path, err))
    48  	}
    49  	no := atomic.AddInt32(&instanceNo, 1)
    50  	dir = &DirectoryLister{Path: cleaned, Abs: abs, Results: make(chan *EntryResult),
    51  		sdChan: make(chan struct{}),
    52  		output: make(chan *EntryResult, chanSize),
    53  		pinger: make(chan struct{}, 1),
    54  		no:     no, name: fmt.Sprintf("dir%d", no)}
    55  	go dir.reader()
    56  	go dir.forwarder()
    57  	return
    58  }
    59  
    60  func (dir *DirectoryLister) Shutdown() {
    61  	if dir.isShutdown.Set() {
    62  		close(dir.sdChan)
    63  	}
    64  }
    65  
    66  func (dir *DirectoryLister) reader() {
    67  	name := dir.name + "reader"
    68  	output := dir.output
    69  	defer close(output)
    70  	defer parl.Recover(name, nil, func(err error) { output <- GetErrorResult(err) })
    71  
    72  	pinger := dir.pinger
    73  	for {
    74  		if n := cap(output) - len(output); n > 0 {
    75  			dir.read(n)
    76  			if dir.readEnd {
    77  				break
    78  			}
    79  		}
    80  		select {
    81  		case <-dir.sdChan:
    82  		case _, ok := <-pinger:
    83  			if ok {
    84  				continue
    85  			}
    86  		}
    87  		break
    88  	}
    89  }
    90  
    91  func (dir *DirectoryLister) read(n int) {
    92  
    93  	// os.Open of directory
    94  	d := dir.dirFile
    95  	var err error
    96  	if d == nil {
    97  		if d, err = os.Open(dir.Path); err != nil {
    98  			dir.flagError(err)
    99  			return
   100  		}
   101  		dir.dirFile = d
   102  	}
   103  
   104  	// read directory
   105  	var entries []fs.DirEntry // interface
   106  	if entries, err = d.ReadDir(n); err != nil {
   107  		if err != io.EOF {
   108  			dir.flagError(err)
   109  		}
   110  		dir.close()
   111  		return
   112  	}
   113  	for _, entry := range entries {
   114  		var fileInfo fs.FileInfo // interface
   115  		fileInfo, err = entry.Info()
   116  		if err != nil {
   117  			dir.flagError(err)
   118  			dir.close()
   119  			return
   120  		}
   121  		var stat *syscall.Stat_t
   122  		if s, ok := fileInfo.Sys().(*syscall.Stat_t); ok {
   123  			stat = s
   124  		}
   125  		dir.output <- &EntryResult{DLEntry: GetEntry(dir.Path, dir.Abs, entry, fileInfo, stat)}
   126  	}
   127  }
   128  
   129  func (dir *DirectoryLister) forwarder() {
   130  	name := dir.name + "forwarder"
   131  	defer close(dir.Results)
   132  	defer parl.Recover(name, nil, func(err error) { dir.Results <- GetErrorResult(err) })
   133  	pinger := dir.pinger
   134  	defer close(pinger)
   135  
   136  	in := dir.output
   137  	for {
   138  		result, ok := <-in
   139  		if !ok {
   140  			break
   141  		}
   142  		if len(pinger) == 0 {
   143  			pinger <- struct{}{}
   144  		}
   145  		dir.Results <- result
   146  	}
   147  }
   148  
   149  func (dir *DirectoryLister) close() {
   150  	if d := dir.dirFile; d != nil {
   151  		dir.dirFile = nil
   152  		if err := d.Close(); err != nil {
   153  			dir.flagError(err)
   154  		}
   155  	}
   156  	dir.end()
   157  }
   158  
   159  func (dir *DirectoryLister) flagError(err error) {
   160  	parl.Debug("flagError: %v\n", err)
   161  	dir.Results <- GetErrorResult(err)
   162  	dir.end()
   163  }
   164  
   165  func (dir *DirectoryLister) end() {
   166  	if !dir.readEnd {
   167  		dir.readEnd = true
   168  	}
   169  }
   170
